subsection_name: beo-phi.json_1_Degree of obesity according to BMI index
subsection_content:
Nowadays obesity is determined mainly based on height and weight by calculating body mass index (BMI). This is an indirect tool used to measure body fat and determine whether a person is obese or not. Therefore, BMI indices will be applied to all adults aged 20 and over, regardless of age and gender.
How to calculate BMI by dividing weight (in kilograms) by height squared (in meters).
BMI from 25.0 to 29.9 is equivalent to overweight.; BMI from 30.0 to 34.9 is diagnosed with level 1 obesity; BMI from 35.0 to 39.9 is diagnosed with level 2 obesity; A BMI of 40.0 or higher is called extreme or severe obesity (grade 3 obesity).
